Australia: The ship Cataraqui was wrecked off King Island in Bass Strait. It is Australia's worst civil maritime disaster, with 406 lives lost. Copper was discovered at Burra in South Australia.
Belgium: Sylvain Van de Weyer replaces Jean-Baptiste Nothomb as Prime Minister
Brazil:
Ragamuffin War: Peace negotiations led by Lima e Silva and Antônio Vicente da Fontoura conclude with the signing of the Ponche Verde Treaty between the two sides, in Dom Pedrito
The Aberdeen Act is passed by the Parliament of the United Kingdom empowering the British Royal Navy to search Brazilian ships as part of the abolition of the slave trade from Africa.
Colombia: Tomás Cipriano de Mosquera is President of the Republic of New Granada
Haiti: President Guerrier dies in office; the State Council appoints Jean-Louis Pierrot President of Haiti
India:
First Anglo-Sikh Wars (to 1849)
Vasudev Balwant Phadke is born (to 1883)
Singapore: The Straits Times was established as The Straits Times and Singapore Journal of Commerce.
Slovenia: First works on the "Southern Railway" between Celje and Ljubljana begin,
Tonga: George Tupou completed his conquest and unification of Tonga and moved the capital to Nukuʻalofa.
Vietnam: Emperor Thiệu Trị (1841–1847) became ruler of Vietnam. USS Constitution lands in Da Nang as a company of US Marines moves overland to Huế and rescues a French Bishop who had been captured by the Vietnamese.
